intro: Corbassona deplanchei, commonly known as the desert dandelion, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads that resemble a single bloom. The plant produces small, yellow to orange flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically narrow and succulent, adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Corbassona deplanchei is often found growing on rocky soils and is well-suited to survive in harsh, desert-like conditions.
